solution_line_template: At his first speed, Kevin ran {speed1} miles per hour * {time1} hours = <<{speed1}*{time1}={distance1}>>{distance1} miles.
At his second speed, he ran {speed2} miles per hour * {time2} hours = <<{speed2}*{time2}={distance2}>>{distance2} miles.
15 minutes is a quarter of an hour so at his third speed, he ran {speed3} miles per hour * {time3} hours = <<{speed3}*{time3}={distance3}>>{distance3} miles.
Therefore, Kevin ran a total of {distance1} miles + {distance2} miles + {distance3} miles = <<{distance1}+{distance2}+{distance3}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} miles.
